topic.title: Port Sub Arbitration mode (INTERNAL)

body.p: This field is used to configure the port sub arbitration mode: fairness mode(0) and performance mode(1).

In case of fairness mode, the requesting source ports follow the anticipated grant sequence order unless there is a stack access conflict or if the source ports are not programmed weights that can sustain the egress port bandwidth. The ports that have consumed their arbitration weights can never get any further grants within the arbitration window until the arbitration weights get reloaded. As such, this mode ensures that all requesting ports have been granted fairly within the arbitration window with the hysteresis counts controlling the second order fairness among the granted ports.

In case of performance mode, the requesting ports that have exhausted their weights can get granted whenever there is no available port with a qualified TLP request and non-zero arbitration weight. As such, under certain conditions, there is potential starvation for the ports with TLP requests that got disqualified due to stack access conflict.
